creator.name: Hoge Raad van de Nederlandse West-Indische Bezittingen / Koloniale Raad
creator.name_english: High Council of the Netherlands West Indian Possessions / Colonial Council
creator.his_func: The High Council for the West Indian Possessions was established in 1828 as an advisory body to the Governor-General who presided over it, and it had its seat in Paramaribo. Aside from the Governor-General, the Council consisted of the Attorney-General, the Controller-General of finances, the Commissioner of the estates of the state and the Commissioner for the indigenous population, slaves, poor relief, education and church affairs. The Council was administratively supported by a secretary. In 1833 the High Council was replaced by the Colonial Council. In this body six of the most prominent citizens of the colony held a seat together with the Attorney-General, the administrator of finances and the Governor-General as president. The Government secretary supplied the administrative support.
